snippet: The first modern wolf-hunting season in Minnesota and Wisconsin is raising concerns among those who are trying to protect the animals.
abstract: Wolf hunting in Wisconsin and Minnesota, which had been legalized to manage rebounding wolf population, has drawn lawsuits from local and national animal rights groups that fear  undoing of nearly four decades of work to restore a healthy number of wolves.
lead_paragraph: The first modern wolf-hunting season in Minnesota and Wisconsin is raising concerns among those who are trying to protect the animals.

headline.seo: Friction Between Wolf Hunters and Protectors Rises
headline.main: As Wolves’ Numbers Rise, So Does Friction Between Guardians and Hunters
headline.print_headline: As Wolves’ Numbers Rise, So Does Friction Between Guardians and Hunters

keywords.value: Humane Society of the United States
keywords.name: organizations
